Articles.Content:
What could you possibly have lied about?

I don't know I'm just happy you didn't kill anyone.

I like the cruiser all those I-beams must kill FPS.You colour parts with a mod from Texel called Kerb-paint.

I like the cruiser all those I-beams must kill FPS.You colour parts with a mod from Texel called Kerb-paint.

it does, however i'm not sure whether to choose over the beams, with potentially beter armour and easy placement or the plates that are annoying as f@ck to align

I don't know I'm just happy you didn't kill anyone.

I got your VTOL fighter. I think that means you don't have anything that can hit me this turn.

Would anyone be up for a fighter only battle?

(testing the anti-everything-missile)

@ panfish, how many fighters? and what do you consider the part/tonnage limit for a fighter?

@Spearka, you're gonna need to spread them out a little, Kerbal cant cope with that many parts so close together once stuff starts exploding, plus you're rather vulnerable to collateral damage with ships like that.

Edit: You're batteries are also going flat...

Edited November 9, 2013 by Mr Tegu

Probably 4 fighters and I don't care about the tonnage but I would like a part limit of 300 for each ship.I think the tonnage limit for a fighter is about 25 tonnes. Maybe the fight could be around Pol?
well, my fighters weigh in at 10 t and 100 parts each, how does that compare to your's? (I can quite happily add an extra 15 t of fuel and armour if need be)
So is everyone geared up for the release of Kerbal Powers tomorrow.

after much toiling about and patiently waiting over the immense lag, I have made tweaks and positioned two Griselbrand cruiser and a Brand new Thraben-Class cruiser (yes, that happened too)

Thraben-Class Cruiser

the biggest federation vehicle currently and is designed as a multipurpose cruiser, it can dispatch fighters easily with its arsenal of six AFS-2 pods, can engage cruisers at long range with its two Bol-class missiles mounted on either side and at close range with its Damnation-class missiles, it is also equipped with a new, as of yet untested form of armour

Griselbrand-class Corvette

Originally designed for the Spiritwolf/Hanland conflict (wink wink) the Griselbrand-class cruiser is a anti-fighter cruiser with Bol-class missiles equipped, the recently upgraded version includes enhanced armour and 6 AFS-2 pods as opposed to its original four

Javascript is disabled. View full album

i parked a Thraben in orbit and placed 2 Griselbrands with it, feel free to pew pew

DOWNLOAD PERSISTENT FILE HEER

P.S.i seem to have noticed most of you have somehow managed to color your aero parts, i hate to sound like a noob but how did you do that?

that is a lot o parts lol.

My fighter that I will be using is 24 tons. Not sure what is adding the extra weight and the part count is like 117 if I recall correctly. Feel free to add more fuel or armour and I think a good battle spot would be low mun orbit.

So is everyone geared up for the release of Kerbal Powers tomorrow.

I was unaware of it. How does one join?

Never mind. This game looks an awful lot like Nation States crossed with HOMEWORK.

I'll watch from the sidelines.

Edited November 9, 2013 by daemonCaptrix
Nation states is a blog based game is it not? And unfortunately the homework is on my end mostly.

I tried to build a SSTO capital ship using slipstream engines. Instead, I got this.

TrollPhysics.png

Doh!, is it the same everytime?

@panfish: I've got 5 of these in Munar orbit, they're 24t and 160 parts:

file: http://www./?6fovq8cz4kbcsc2

@ everyone: would someone else like to fight Spearka once he sorts his persist file out? Seems a bit rude hogging all fights.

Also, I have a prototype of the new Dominator class in LKO, the challenge is to kill it in least amount of shots (no 2.5m torps!):

Winner gets a hurricane Mk4 craft file:

EDIT: forgot this: http://www./?c78ywgeccmvaib0

Edited November 9, 2013 by Mr Tegu

that is a lot o parts lol.

maybe a bit too many, using the I-beams nearly doubled the part count for the Griselbrand corvette, i think I might stick back to the panels and start over, i may also throw in a few drones
its not the parts of the individual ships that's causing the problem, its how close they are together but yeah, I beams don't make very efficient plate (but they are effective).
Spar i want to put a link to your thread on the Kerbal Powers thread is that ok wit you

>removed due to misunderstanding

Edited November 9, 2013 by Spearka

I got your VTOL fighter. I think that means you don't have anything that can hit me this turn.

Apart from the Destroyers,Fighters,the entire carrier.You don't need VTOL engines to land.

Spartwo i want to put a link to your thread on the Kerbal Powers thread is that ok wit you

Sure I notice you have no rules for space combat copy n'paste if you want.

Edited November 9, 2013 by Spartwo
Would anyone call pushing that weapon I found into a ship cheating?
Would anyone call pushing that weapon I found into a ship cheating?

>somewhat broken GIF<

I'll take that as a yes.It wouldn't have worked as both ships were landed.

Boop:http://www./download/wgk7yosf9bfi7uu/persistent.sfs

You know how you said the Broadsword was the only ship with VTOL capabilities....nope.

Of course the TWR is so frickin low,I had to hold shift constantly.

Picked up some weapons/boost system from London(Damn attachment issues).I hoped to orbit low enough to not need to land turns out was 800m too high.

I abandoned the Bottom booster as it became more of a hindrance.

The middle boost did some damage destroying the rear tank severing VTOL engines and half of the main engines.

>Too busy aiming<

First shot.Had no effect ie:missed

Second shot.Broke off decrotive armor at front.

Third shot.Tore off some of the armor covering the right nacelle.

Forth shot.Destroyed the right nacelle.

Returning to orbit was tough and terrifying.

Returning to base.(I ran out of RCS during ascent)

Edited November 9, 2013 by Spartwo

Javascript is disabled. View full album

i redid both crafts making them a little more lag-friendly and they are spaced apart better, i also splashed some fancy-pants paint on it
